reviews.title: Good base for Toronto City
reviews.text: I took three teenagers to the Homewood Inn for a two night stay as their introduction to North America. The Homewood Inn proved to be good, basic accommodation, clean and with parking and air-con. However the two factors which raised it to 4 stars were its central location and the helpfulness of our hosts. On the first afternoon John sat me down and explained all the possible sights we could see in the city and gave them a ranking. This enabled us to make maximum use of what proved to be too short a time in Toronto. The location is close to Jarvis and not too far from buses and the subway system. This meant we didn't have to use our car for the time we stayed in the city.We had two spacious rooms on the ground floor, in the adjacent house. The rooms, and indeed the whole locale, had seen grander days but there were no problems and we all slept very comfortably. Breakfast was good wholesome food with pletny for everyone. And in the garden there were racoons and black (yes, black) squirrels for amusement.Would we stay there again? Yes, definitely and - providing you aren't looking for mundane 5 star accommodation - so should you!

reviews.title: Best service and the best rooms we've had all trip!
reviews.text: Very good Bed & Breakfast which has a very homey atmosphere. The people of the B&b are very nice and are very willing to help you. The rooms are big clean and air-conditioned, and some of them have a refrigerator. Another advantage for this bed & breakfast is that it is situated in down town Toronto.

reviews.title: Home Away from Home
reviews.text: The title speaks for itself. Each time I visit Toronto I return to Homewood Inn because of the cozy setting and friendly atmosphere. I am pleased with my well-furnished and well-kept room and the solicitous care I receive. I will certainly come back to Homewood Inn on my next visit from overseas. I highly recommend this place to all travellers and visitors.

reviews.title: Disappointing
reviews.text: I don't know what rooms the other reviewers stayed in, but it sure wasn't ours! Our room in a house two doors down was dingy and ugly. The blinds were broken, the room smelled, and there were no niceties like a box of Kleenex or drinking glasses. Luckily it wasn't cold, because the only extra blanket was a crocheted spread sitting at the bottom of the closet. The bedside table was dirty.The shared bathroom was clean, but rather run down. The kitchen was passable. Is this really a rooming house?On the plus side, Edie was very friendly and helpful with advice for restaurants (I recommend Just Thai on Church St.) and using the public transit. Breakfast was passable, although the sausages were cold.It sufficed for a one night get together with an old friend who wasn't choosy, but I'm glad I wasn't there longer and certainly I wouldn't stay there again.

reviews.title: Friendly, clean and excellent service
reviews.text: Everytime I visit Toronto, I always make sure that I stay in Homewood Inn.  Homewood Inn is like a second home.  Staffs are really friendly and sensitive to your personal needs.  Place is really clean and cheap.  Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Helpful and Informative
reviews.text: The great people at Homewood will tell you where to go and where not to go (very important), how much it will cost you and where you can save money.  They have very simple accommodations but you're not there to stay in your room.  It's also cheap!  Great breakfast!  Great deal!  Will always come back when in Toronto.

reviews.title: Homewood Inn - the best B&B in Toronto
reviews.text: I arrived at the Homewood Inn in Toronto for a month-long stay, not really knowing what to expect. I was pleasantly surprised. The staff were very welcoming and friendly, and always available for a chat and suggestions of what to do during my stay in Toronto (good knowledge of their city!). The rooms were clean, spacious and well furnished with all the modern amenities such as a TV, fridge-freezer and an air  conditioner too. There are also laundry facilities.Every morning we would enjoy a hearty breakfast, cooked and served individually and promptly. The Inn is also in a good location, being walking distance to two subway stops (which means it is pretty much connected to every part of the city). On the whole, this was an outstanding Bed and Breakfast, and one I am sure I will visit again on my next trip to the beautiful city of Toronto, ON, Canada!

reviews.title: Loved the Homewood Inn
reviews.text: I can definitely recommend to stay at the Homewood Inn in case you are looking for a reasonable priced place to stay at downtown Toronto. I really enjoyed my time there. Everybody was very friendly and helpful creating a nice and homely atmosphere. I got a lot of information useful about places to visit throughout the toronto area. Many attractions, especially in the downtown area are within walking distance.The breakfast was absolutely fantastic and nearly more one can eat.Overall I can say, that the Homewood Inn was so good, that I will return there for sure in case I ever come back to Toronto. And I definitely wish to, the city is fantastic.

reviews.title: Thanks for excellent stay
reviews.text: I stayed over at the Homewood Inn and was extremely pleased with the warm reception of its hosts and with the pleasing & cosy accomodation that is being offered. All staff have been very helpful to make this stay as comfortable as possible, providing a feeling of being at home.Being so close to the bustling Toronto city center, the place is at the same time located in a peaceful and tranquil tree-lined street, allowing one to come to a complete rest when reaching home. I also enjoyed its proximity to the Allan Gardens and its beautiful botanical garden in which I spent some relaxing moments. Thanks again to Mme Dolores, Eadie and John and hoping to see you again soon at my next visit to Toronto.JVE

reviews.title: Wonderful Place to Stay
reviews.text: This place was a wonderful place to stay, very clean great service and very helpful staff. The breakfast provided was great. Definately reccommend that you stay. Also very affordable!!!!

reviews.title: It's like seeing friends
reviews.text: Location: right in the heart of downtown TO.  3 mins walk from Wellsley station.  Shared kitchen to cook your own food if you want.Cost: $80 for a double bed with shared bath.  Can't beat that.Decor: home feel, retro into the 60's, a bit old but very tidy.Experience: the breakfast is generous and fresh.  Lots of return customers, and most of them want to keep this place a secret as none of us want the price to go up :>    Very friendly owners Delores and Eadie, eager to show you where and how to get to places in their hometown.   I was very lucky to get upgraded to their Norfolk Suite (very large suite with private bath in the main house).  Thanks Eadie.     See you folks next time.  Patrick

reviews.title: REALLY GOOD, RELIABLE VALUE!!!
reviews.text: From 1995 to 2012, I have had the good fortune to experience the hospitality of The Homewood Inn near Sherbourne and College.  The accomodations have been consistently very satisfactory and heart warming when I have been alone using private bath or with a group of 10 in a flat with shared bathrooms.  The location is 30 min walking distance from the different places I need to go.  I feel safe with locked, gated and off street parking always available. Fees are reasonable;breakfast good and pleantiful; staff friendly and accomodating;furnishings are clean, comfortable, functional and eclectic. Well done and thank you Eadie, Dolores and Staff for creating my welcoming, dependable home in Toronto!

reviews.title: Friendly, clean and affordable
reviews.text: I have stayed at the Homewood Inn for business travel for the last year and a half. The owners are committed to making your stay enjoyable and comfortable on all levels. I would highly recommend this Bed and Breakfast to anyone traveling on business or pleasure who desires a great accommodation experience at a decent price in the heart of Toronto

reviews.title: Not fancy, but really cozy.
reviews.text: This is a small tiny place, nothing fancy, but clean and quiet, thouroghly enjoyable. It's in walking distance from the centre, the people are really nice, I really didn't lack any comfort. Great value for money. Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Home Away From Home
reviews.text: Every year when I come to Toronto for a short visit, I stay at Homewood Inn. And each year when it is time to leave the city, I return home with fond memories of my stay at the inn. It's just so warm and cozy with the friendliness of the hostesses, Dolores and her daughter Eadie, and other guests. The rooms are clean and comfortable, and breakfast is enjoyable. In the summer one has the pleasure of sitting on the front porch in the early morning and evening with a good cup of coffee or a cool drink just like at home. These occasions can be quiet and relaxing or spent in amiable conversations with other friendly guests from all over the world. Downtown shopping and entertainment are a walk away, as are the subway lines for those who wish to go out more often. Hotels are too impersonal and lonely for me, along with being too expensive in comparison, so Homewood Inn is where I like to stay each year when I'm in town. Thank you Dolores and Eadie for your warm hospitality. And Eadie, I look forward to doing more crossword puzzles with you on the front porch next summer when I come back.

reviews.title: Excellent!
reviews.text: I've stayed at the Homewood Inn on and off for the last 10 years (my job requires that I overnight in Toronto frequently). I love this place! Zero complaints. The accommodations, though older, are extremely clean and well-kept; the staff is very friendly; the atmosphere is warm and peaceful; and the location is great, as is the price. Exceptional value!

reviews.title: Would not recommend it at all
reviews.text: We had 2 rooms for 2 nights. Rooms are not nice at all, really really old and do not really seem clean. The bathroom was at pretty bad condition as well. When breakfast was made in the morning (breakfast was not bad but not supergood either) you could already smell it in the room, beginning 7am, actually you could smell fried egg in the whole house.Owners/staff not rude but not pleasant either.Good things about it: pretty cheap and not too far from the centre. That's it!

reviews.title: Excellent hosts, accomodations, location, and price!!!
reviews.text: I am from Nova Scotia and I've stayed in Toronto at some different hotels in the past while on vacation. I've stayed at the Homewood Inn 3 times in the past couple of years. I've stayed by myself, with my girlfriend, and also another time with my Dad. The staff is so friendly and were able to accomodate any different needs travelling with these different companions. The accomodations are excellent, the location is perfect and best of all the prices are great. You will not get a better deal on an accomodation and location like this in Toronto, not to mention they are great hosts and breakfast is included. This is always my first choice of accomodations when visting Toronto. The accomodation, location, price, and service are second to none in Toronto!

reviews.title: Friendliness and Warmth of Toronto through this B&B!
reviews.text: Hadn't visited Toronto for over 20 years, lived there once upon a time. Used to view Toronto as cold and unfriendly. Pleasantly, completely changed my mind with this great global city. Best way to reintroduce myself to Toronto was through this hotel. Very warm and considerate owners--took their time out of busy day to give you a real sense of welcome. I have been many B&B's in Britain and Europe and was surprised that the best is in my own country. Price extremely reasonable for downtown Toronto, close to all the facilities.  Breakfast was large and the best I have had in about 40 B&Bs. Caters to an international clientele which makes it interesting. Buildings and rooms are cozy late Victorian.

reviews.title: Homey and a good value
reviews.text: We have been staying at the Homewood Inn on our visits to Toronto for many years now and have always found it to be clean and friendly.  This is NOT an expensive, fancy, pretentious luxury accommodation fit for snobs,  but actually a very comfortable alternative and a real good value for the price. There is a great variety of rooms and fully self-contained suite-and room combinations available in three large older houses centrally located on a quiet street. The atmosphere is relaxed, the rooms homey, and the staff very pleasant and helpful. Like us, many Guests are 'regulars' and tend to be easy-going and friendly.

reviews.title: Wonderful central hideaway
reviews.text: What a great place.  I had trouble getting a hotel room and was lucky enough to stumble on the Homewood Inn through web browsing.  It is located, on beautiful Homewood Avenue, within walking distance of the Yonge/Wellesley Subway entrance .The house is charming, built in 1828, and it's charm is only exceeded by that of the hosts; Dolores and her daughter, Eadie.  They are very accommodating and thoughtful.  The rooms are large, the beds comfortable, and the breakfast is great.  On top of everything there is FREE PARKING!  A real plus for Toronto.  My 3 nights there will not be my last visit.

reviews.title: Seen better days
reviews.text: I've been to Toronto a number of times and wanted a different experience (plus none of the available hotels were places I could afford or would want to stay at). Homewood Inn seemed like a nice change of pace. The neighborhood is not bad, not great, but not bad. The location was great for our needs.  We were greeted by the owner and after a quick orientation were shown to our room. We opted for the private bath which meant a 3rd floor room. Now, I am all for charming but, this place needs some serious updating. We get to our room and I have to say it was much larger than I expected. The down side to that was, it was a very hot day and the AC unit could not cool the room enough. The bed was surprisingly comfortable. The couch was not at all comfortable. After a solid night's sleep, we went down for breakfast. Now this is not the first B&B I've been in so I had expectations. I was disappointed. When we got to the breakfast room we were offered cereal or oatmeal and had to ask if there were other options. Eggs (any style) were offered. We opted for over medium. Coffee and juice were available for the taking. The eggs  were done correctly and came with hash brown potatos the only problem was there were literally 6 pieces of hash browns. the woman who came into the dining room after us knew what to expect and asked for extra hash browns. She got 8 pieces. Check out was painless. Sooo, final evaluation: pluses: Good location, comfy bed, big room free parking. Minuses: worn out facility, lame breakfast, overall room comfort lacking. Would we stay here again? Probably not.

reviews.title: I love Homewood Inn in Toronto
reviews.text: I have been going to Homewood Inn in Toronto for a few years now, and everytime time i have a new boyfriend, i bring him to Homewood Inn, which means every year hahahahahaha. They are so welcoming and i love the intimate ambiance, am feeling like am a part of the family there. Now that i am married, my husband and i, will go again and again, because we always go for Gay Pride, every year, and Homewood Inn is now my home in Toronto. So keep it up Eadie and Dolores, Cantelli loves you. Hugs and kisses from Montreal.

reviews.title: Absolutely Awful
reviews.text: STEER CLEAR OF THIS PLACE!!! Toronto is not to be judged by this horribly-run inn. It was soiled and dirty from the front step to the guest rooms to the breakfast area. Revolting. My room was never cleaned and the communal bathroom was gross. It is amazing to me that this place hasn't been shut down. The pictures are misleading. The only good thing is the staff, however how can you like people who do such a terrible job?

reviews.title: be careful
reviews.text: We were looking for a modest place with two rooms for several nights and thought the reviews on Trip Advisor sounded OK.  We were very disappointed.  Don't want to be too critical because the main house may be better, but we were down the street, the two rooms were separated by a shabby kitchen, dining room, and living room.  Obviously an apartment passing as a B & B.  Not particulalry clean and very musty.  Shades that let in too much light at night, with  no curtains to block it.  Breakfast was OK, but if not a meat eater you found nothing to replace it.  The carnivores seemed happy with it, and it appeared the rooms in the other house were better.  But ask WHERE you will be before you sign up or you could be unhappy.  Service was fine and family was very helpful with directions, suggestions, etc.

reviews.title: terrific
reviews.text: Yes the buildings are old, but the rooms that I have stayed in are clean.  It is located on a nice quiet tree lined street  only a 10 minutes walk from the heart of downtown Toronto.I had to arrive early (like 6am) one day.  The owner had no problem letting me in as soon as they opened and even insisted that I have breakfast, on the house.  Parking was included in the rate (usally about $25.00 for 24 hours in this part of the city)  Throughout the day whenever they saw me, they asked if there was anything I needed or that they could do.   And yes the price is absolutely right for downtown Toronto.I have stayed here may times before and will continue to stay and recommend it to others.Joe (Bracebridge, Ontario)

reviews.title: Best Deal in Toronto
reviews.text: A friend and I had booked a night here simply because it was right behind a concert venue which he had tickets for the night of. We paid about 50$ each for a split room which is super reasonably priced compared to the rest of toronto. It's in walking distance of downtown Toronto as well as many other areas. Highly recommend this place if you're staying in town for a night or two. The Allen gardens was literally just down the street which was also really nice and convenient. Staff was super helpful and made sure we had everything we needed and made sure we were safe at night, is being two girls alone.

reviews.title: Thrifty accomodation at a great location
reviews.text: I have been staying at Homewood Inn for a number of years now, each June-July for Pride weekend/Canada Day weekend.  I first was directed to it about 5 or 6 years ago when a friend's B&B was full.  It's perfect for me as far as location, as I have a friend who lives around the corner who I spend time with while I am there, plus the village is just a few short blocks to the west.If you are looking for posh, you need to go to the Mariott.  However, if you are looking for location at affordable prices, this will work for you.  The breakfast is a good size, at least I think so. I generally only get half of what's offered. I look forward to my stays there each year, particularly to see Dolores and Eadie.

reviews.title: Homewood Inn, a good place
reviews.text: Toronto is 100 miles away.  I am there often.  I could not afford downtown hotels and the antiseptic impersonality of them is not comfortable for me.  Last weekend, again, I stayed at the Homewood Inn.  And thought what a good place and how lucky I am to have it.  On a quiet still not overly gentrified street right downtown in the Toronto neighbourhoods, the Church Wellesley Village and Cabbagetown, close to everything in Toronto's great downtown on foot or nearby streetcar, bus and subway.  Shady front porch where people sit.  A good 24-hour grocery a block away.  Nice communal kitchen, which is important to me.  It has been there for decades, founded by its present owners who with all their experience are the people who look out for you as their guests in every way that you want and let you live your independent lives.  All the rooms are different, some palatially large, some small.  Comfortable beds.  Generous breakfasts.  Shared bathrooms except for the suites that have their own bathroom.  Nearby Allan Gardens Victorian glass house of exotic plants.  A handy branch of the Toronto Public library.  A great original theatre, Buddies in Bad Times.

reviews.title: Hospitality at it's BEST!
reviews.text: The Homewood Inn has become my "home away from home." Since finding this amazing B & B in spring 2012, I have returned every trip back to Toronto.Delores and Eadie always make sure I feel welcome coming through the door checking in. Always a smile and a genuine "how was your trip here today?" I travel at least once a month from Northern Ontario to Toronto, a six (6) hour drive.Upon checking in, I know I can relax in the quiet and comfort off my room.A hearty breakfast with your choice of coffee, tea, juice, hot or cold cereals and choice of bacon or sausage, eggs the way you choose, potatoes and toast. All types of condiments are available to complete this.Full kitchen available if needed, and bar fridges in rooms. The patio, is a great place to relax and chat with guests.Private parking is available as well.I have been staying here for eighteen (18) months now, and wouldn't think of staying anywhere else in Toronto.

reviews.title: The perfect place to stay
reviews.text: I attended the XVI. International Aids Conference in Toronto which took place in Toronto / Canada in my role as a reporter for Irish radio station NEAR FM. Concern Worldwide who paid for the trip and who in turn get all the footage for their website booked me into the Homewood Inn which lies in a quiet road. The minute you enter the Homewood Inn you can feel the warmth of the place. Eadie and all the other staff are friendly and genuinely interested in you as a person. They always call you by name and engage easily in conversations about whatever comes to mind. Apart from spacious and clean rooms and a very nice breakfast it is true to say that the intimacy and openness of the Homewood Inn makes this place unique. It is close to the inner city and the subway and if they call you a taxi to the airport you´ll get a flatrate. The prices start at $ 65 Canadian Dollars for a single room including breakfast and the price is a good one considering the efforts made to make you feel welcome and home. There are no en - suite rooms but the bathrooms are spacious and very clean. For more conservative guests it could be a bit worrying that the streets nearby are owned by prostitutes at night although they don´t bother people at all.

reviews.title: So friendly and relaxing
reviews.text: Where do I start?  From the moment I arrived at the Homewood Inn I was made to feel as if I were at home, Dolores, Eadie & John all pride themselves on this!The location is fantastic for visiting Downtown Toronto, with all attractions only a short walk away...But at the same time, Homewood Avenue is a peaceful backstreet and you'd really not know how close you were to all the attractions.  I travel a lot and have high standards, which the Homewood Inn met with flying colours!!  I would recommend for anyone taking a trip to book into the Homewood Inn.  Thank you so much for a wonderful week and I hope to be visiting again very soon.

reviews.title: Home away from home at Homewood Inn
reviews.text: My husband and I have returned from Toronto after a wonderfull visit with our son, who is freshman at the University of Toronto. We had stayed at Homewood Inn and have been so happy with our stay that we wish to write a great review.The warm and friendly staff at the Inn made us feel so comfortable that we felt like 'home'.  The Inn (a Victorian style house) is in a lovely area, centrally located and is walking distance to many centers of visit, subways,great restaurants, and most of all, a short walk to the Univ.of Toronto campus, where we visited daily to be with our son.  Not only did we stay in a cozy room, we had hot breakfasts every morning.  The staff were always so helpful with any information that we needed, but the one fact that touched our hearts, was that they actually invited our son to stay with us for a weekend at no charge.  Such hospitality and warmth are rare especially in big cities..In summary, it is definitely without a doubt that we'll return to Homewood Inn soon and every time we visit Toronto.

reviews.title: Terrible B&B at a good price...
reviews.text: The only thing good about this B&B was the price. It must be the most run down, tired, old & ugliest B&B I've ever stayed in!  The staff was not friendly - who the other reviewers had contact with, I really don't know! Bathrooms are all shared, breakfast nothing to write home about, our room was damp and cold, the street is a haven for prostitutes with cars circling the area without end - I certainly would NEVER stay there again.

reviews.title: Lice invested and dirty
reviews.text: On the surface it "looks" clean, however matresses are invested with bedbugs, and lice. Beware!!

reviews.title: Nothing to write home about...
reviews.text: Homewood Inn's location is good if you want to be near the gay village, but that's about it. The place is tired and the owner's daughter rude and unfriendly - why she's involved in the Inn is a mystery - she obviosly hates it there. If your standards are pretty boring & low re a place to stay, this bed and breakfast is a good option for you in Toronto.

reviews.title: Best deal in Toronto for human lice and bed bugs!!
reviews.text: Matrass was covered with plastic bag and bad odor in room because of bed bugs. Cleaning staff hardly cleans room. Only swipe floor once a week with vinegar, I suppose to scare bed bugs away. When asked owner to improve cleanliness she answered: " I could not care less." Struggled now for months to get rid of bugs. Never had any experience like this!!

reviews.title: In need of renovation
reviews.text: Most of your reviewers seem to have stayed in a different B and B to me. My partner and I stayed one night in June, and we found the hotel to be very scruffy and badly in need of renovation. I have stayed in some beautiful b and b's in Canada and the owners are very proud of their homes. This one was sad and neglected. The bed was comfortable, the breakfast was mediocre. The only positive was the location.

reviews.title: Bed bugs beware!!!!
reviews.text: Be aware bedbugs! Strange odor in rooms, Rooms very dark and building rundown! In need of serous renovation. Sheets are not changed on regular basis. Breakfast very basic nothing special. Rooms not clean.

reviews.title: Cute Place Great Price
reviews.text: I happened to stumble across Homewood Inn via google because it was behind a concert venue. Great location with a great price! I will be coming to this Inn more often when my visits in Toronto require staying the night.
